website_summaries.verdict: The Panasonic DMP-BDT210's built-in Wi-Fi, simple user interface, Amazon Instant streaming, and blazing fast disc-loading speeds make it our favorite Blu-ray player of 2011 so far.
pros: The Panasonic DMP-BDT210 has built-in Wi-Fi, a simple user interface, and an excellent suite of streaming-media services, including Netflix, Amazon Instant, Vudu, Pandora, Skype, and CinemaNow
The DMP-BDT210 also has the fastest overall disc-loading speeds we've tested
And though its "touch-free" disc tray opener is a little gimmicky, we found it occasionally useful
cons: The Panasonic DMP-BDT210 has fewer overall streaming services than some competitors, missing some high-profile services like Hulu Plus and MLB.TV
It also lacks onboard memory for accessing BD-Live features

customer_reviews.title: poor Wi-Fi reception
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in February 2012 and it stopped receiving Wi-Fi four or five times, at least, became a horrible ordeal each time. The last time it stopped working, I called the 800 number and the automated answering service asked if I bought it in the last twenty-four months and no matter whether I said yes or no, the robot kept saying, "I'm sorry. Did you buy it in the last twenty-four months?" and I could never get past that. I emailed Panasonic and told them the problem, and they replied that I should call the 800 number! I'll never buy another Panasonic product nor will I recommend one, unless it's to an enemy.
customer_reviews.author: Aronsha

customer_reviews.title: Painfully slow interface.
customer_reviews.text: I suppose this is a fine blue-ray player in the sense that it plays blu-ray discs and has wifi. But the interface is HORRIBLE. Specifically, it's excruciatingly slow. Push a button on the remote, wait anywhere from 2 to 10 seconds (yes, I said 10 seconds), and the device responds. The delay is so long that you begin to wonder if the device received the signal, so you push the button again only to get the effect of 2 button presses when it finally decides to respond. It is absolutely infuriating to use. I love Panasonic products in general, but this thing suffers from a terribly slow interface.
customer_reviews.author: R.B.

customer_reviews.title: Bought this in 2012 - still working without needing updates!
customer_reviews.text: A lot of players cease working if they don't get updated over wifi or if an update is interrupted. This player has been working without drama all this time! It has RCA jacks and still works - I've had people offer to buy it because it works with their older TVs. Great deal!
customer_reviews.author: truereviewer

customer_reviews.title: MEH. There are Better. And the Remote? What a JOKE!
customer_reviews.text: Plays fine and no big issues, but man this player is ANNOYING! The remote is a ridiculous mess that doesn't have any relation to functions on other "normal" remotes. I read reviews with that complaint but figured it couldn't be that big of a deal. IT IS. Several times I've had to pull out the manual and hunt thru it to figure out operations. When I got a new wireless router, there was no easy way to simply find/connect to it. Again, ANNOYING. It takes a long time to connect to Netflix (both wired & wirelessly) and the on screen menu layout is non-intuitive. Would not buy again. I know there are better options out there.
customer_reviews.author: S Lamar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Blu Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the Panasonic DMP-BDT210 Integrated-Wi-Fi 3D Blu-ray DVD Player for 4 months and I am very happy with its performance. Pros: 1. Very fast initial disk load time. Best in class according to consumer reports. 2. Simple on screen menus. 3. Integrated WiFi. 4. Fun sensor on the top of the player that opens the disk tray. 5. Excellent image quality. 6. Small foot print. Cons: 1. Occasional disk read error if there are ANY finger prints on the disk. Not a deal breaker since it's infrequent. 2. Slightly expensive, but worth it. I would recommend this Blu Ray player as a worthy addition to anyone's home theater system.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding machine for $130 @ Amazon.com
customer_reviews.text: Really nice Blu-ray player. Set up is fast & easy. Menu & remote are easy to navigate. Blu-ray discs are stunning. DVDs also look terrific & load fast. Wireless setup is very simple. VieraCast internet connect menu is nice. Firmware updates are a normal part of the process. Do not fear them due to complaints by some, it doesn't take long. CNET has very informative reviews including a video demo of this unit. Also good info regarding avoiding overpaying for HDMI cables. I purchased a 6 foot, $6 Blue Rigger HDMI cable with this Blu-ray player. I'm using this with my Samsung PN43D450 43" plasma, 720p, 600 Hz refresh rate flat panel TV, and it's a beautiful thing.
customer_reviews.author: CardinalRhythms

customer_reviews.title: Great device. Could use slightly better GUI
customer_reviews.text: Got this player this week. For the price and additional included items/incentives ($20 amazon credit and free Avatar blu-ray)I was enticed to pull the trigger. Got it, installed it, downloaded firmware update, and it was hot. Looks great, very compact yet slick looking device. The touch-free opening feature is a neat gimmick. The only nitpick (and this is true of my Panasonic Plasma as well) is the GUI/menus aren't intuitive in their design. I'm sure once I've used it for a bit it will make more sense. Overall however for the $100 it is a great device and it's inclusion of Hulu, Netflix, and Amazon's streaming content make it a wonderfully useful media device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wi-Fi Integrated Blu-ray Player is Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Received exactly as advertised, in well packed carton, about 7-days after order placement. The integrated Wi-Fi is amazing stuff, set-up was (Netflix) easy, and everything worked on the first try. We were looking for a player with a small footprint and this machine met our dimensional requirements nicely. With HDMI the new connection standard, there are only two cables: power + HDMI, making for tidier cabling management. Suggestion to Panasonic (or any other manufacturer): consider adding power and HDMI input sockets on one, or both, side panels, allowing for the device to be shoved back against a wall or cabinet and cables to trail off to the side, deftly hidden behind stacks of BDs.
customer_reviews.author: M. F. Martischang

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised and more..
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Amazing thing about this player is that it an play on your normal LCD and LED but also plays on the DLP screens. It plays 3D on all types of 3d capable tvs. Others will not play on DLP screens or will not render the image correctly. There is checkerboard option that enables this player to play on DLP. DLPs are still used on projections that are becoming more common so dont rule that out when shopping for a new blu ray player with 3D capabilities. If you get a DLP 3D projector this is must.
customer_reviews.author: The Lopez Family

customer_reviews.title: What a great BluRay player - and plays Amazon Prime vids!
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Loads DVDs and BluRay quickly. Easy to set up. Integrated WiFi sets up easy, works great. Plays AMAZOM PRIME instant video! Has the best open/close feature EVER! Cons..... Does not make poorly written movies any more interesting to watch (I'm talking to you, SMURF MOVIE!) Overall - Best blu-ray player I have ever owned! I thought that the "pass hand over the top of the unit" was a cheesy gimmick until I tried it. No more searching for the dad-blasted button! You will feel like a magician when you pass your hand over the top of the unit and it opens! Take that, David Copperfield!
customer_reviews.author: Spockwithalightsaber

customer_reviews.title: Easy set-up
customer_reviews.text: Very simple set-up. (Entering my wireless password took the most time.). As other reviewers have noted, the weakest link is the remote. I am female, have small hands, and I had problems -- the navigation buttons are located at the bottom of the remote and thus require two-handed operation. Even using both hands, I often clicked on the "Vierra cast" button when I wanted the up arrow. This took me out of set-up and meant working back to the screen I had inadvertently left. This happened about four times, even though I was being quite careful, I thought. I'm using this Panasonic to replace a Roku XS so that I can access Vudu.
customer_reviews.author: S. S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 3D Bluray player
customer_reviews.text: The Panasonic DMP BDT210 3D Bluray player is abosolutely WONDERFUL!!! Straight out of the box the this Bluray player looks beautiful, it is compact and takes up very little room in my tv stand. hooking it up and getting internet connectivity was a BREEZE!!! Logging on to netflix was painless, i just entered my email and password and WALA!!! I was up and streaming movies in HD 1080P. The remote control very user friendly and navigating on VIERACAST is extremely easy to operate and understand. My son loves watching Cars2 in 3D all the time. If you are looking for a 3D Bluray WIFI player look no further because the Panasonic DMP-BDT210 is definately a FIVE STAR!!!!! performer.
customer_reviews.author: antdog02

customer_reviews.title: After 2 years player now skips when playing
customer_reviews.text: We have not used that much and now after 2 years player skips. Same blu-ray disc played fine on another player. (Much less expensive Sony Blue Ray player). Disc was brand new out of packaging. Happened on another disc the last time used, dvd disc...not a bluray so we thought it was the disc. Popped it into our Bose DVD player (10 year old Bose) and worked fine. 2 disc's not working in this one but fine in others. Player should last more than 2 years. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: RC, in ohio

customer_reviews.title: Nice Player
customer_reviews.text: There's not much i can add to what others have already said. I really like it, discs play nice, load quickly. Being able to disable the touchless sensor is great when children are around. My only problem is streaming from my hard drive. I was unable to find much info on what formats were suppported. It turns out you can only play .mkv through the usb port, and apparently only windows format media files over the home network, effectively making almost all my videos useless for this player. It's great for dvd's & blu ray discs, but you will need something else to stream .avi files over your home network.
customer_reviews.author: Josie Harper

customer_reviews.title: Very very recommended
customer_reviews.text: Was great when I used it. Very fast load up. No skipping. The touchless eject is a super cool function where you wave your hand over the top, center of the unit and the disc tray opens, opening the whole front flap exposing the buttons and all. Then another wave, the tray and front close right up, covering all the button for a nice, seamless front. Buy this player if you really need a separate blu ray player. Mine has been relegated to the closet as I don't need to use it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: MinhcallaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Video playback looks amazing Sound quality is great Simple menu's netflix does work on this Cons: Hands free tray opener is gimmicky Viera Cast (apps) screen somewhat clunky and slow Other Thoughts: Works great, no issues so far (1 month). Plays dvds and blu rays flawlessly, I have not had a chance to grab up a 3d blu ray yet and try it out, however the 2d->3d conversion for movies isn't incredible, but noticeable. Built in wifi is convenient and works well, no drop outs or disconnects. If anyone was having second thoughts about this unit, think again. Solid product, and comes with Avatar 3d (MIB)!
customer_reviews.author: Paul R

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: The product shipped from the vendor soon after ordering. It arrived on the last day of the range given at purchase. The packaging was robust, and there was no damage. I configured the DVD to my home wireless network with little trouble. It worked immediately with my wireless N system. The first thing I did was to download the software and firmware update. That went well with no issues. I am now trying to configure my Logitech web cam. It is not immediately obvious how to do it. The manual indicates a proprietary Panasonic camera. This would be a significant limitation to the system.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Orr

customer_reviews.title: Great Player!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on Amazon, this item was set up and working well within 5 minutes. The picture quality is fantastic, and it is able to stream from Amazon, and Netflix easily. The access speed to online services is a little slow compared to my computer, and if a movie is stopped during streaming, (on Amazon), you can get kicked out of the 'net services' area and it can take up to 5 min to get back to your place in the movie. I don't know if the access speed is better in other models/brands, but I am still very happy with the purchase. (I'm connected via wireless, and the speed may be better with a cable connection).
customer_reviews.author: A. Mani

customer_reviews.title: Best one for the price
customer_reviews.text: Just had to get rid of my samsung blu-ray player after only 11 months, it was the worst one i have ever seen, only but problems. This Panasonic is like a Cadillac compare to a Fiat. Is completely silent while the Samsung sounded like a cloncker. It connects to Netflix with no problems and even has a special key on the remote for it. The picture is absolutely perfect, the remote takes some use to but that is normal with any new one. It boots up faster and has a lot of internet applications. Should have checked the reviews on the Samsung here before I bought it. I did check this model and the reviews were right.
customer_reviews.author: goldrule5

customer_reviews.title: Netflix no sound
customer_reviews.text: Not necessarily the player. My blue ray works great, fast upload and all that. Netflix streams great but there is only video and no sound. Both audio and video work when connected to the TV but video only when connected through my Denon AVR-280CI. Panasonic says it is incompatible with the receiver, I believe they are right. Apparently the 310 fixes the problem, I am going to get one and find out. Panasonic makes excellent products but I am surprised they do not disclose the receiver compatibility issue. Blue ray works fine because the sound is encoded on the disc, Netflix is a streaming product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Shipman

customer_reviews.title: Can't Be Beat For The Price
customer_reviews.text: Having upgraded from a Panasonic Blu-Ray player that's a couple years old, this thing is fantastic. Amazingly quick loading, and the touch-top eject is a cool little feature I've been using more than I ever thought I would. Before updating the firmware, I did have Netflix issues, but as mentioned in other reviews here, once the firmware was updated, everything was running great. Wireless connection was a breeze, and I'm really happy to have one less run of wiring running through the snakepit that is the back of my entertainment setup. I'd recomment this player without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Dako

customer_reviews.title: Love it - works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I freaking love this thing. It is so quick and pretty and perfect. I have wi-fi set up and I did not have any of the issues people talk about about having to make a disc or any of that. I plugged hooked it up, turned it on, it found the wi-fi, updated the software on its own, and runs perfectly. The Netflix button on the remote is one of my favorite features as well as its ability to respond to almost all of our other remotes. I would buy it again and recommend without pause.
customer_reviews.author: juliagee

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this player primarily to give me some more options in my bedroom, specifically connecting up to my wireless network and streaming netflix and hulu. Initially I had problems getting the respective streaming software downloaded, but that could have been due to a lot of users online at the same time. Once I got Netflix and Hulu installed, they seem to work fine. I'm using this player with an LG 450 32"LCD TV and the picture is nice. Knock on wood, I havn't experienced the dropped connections some reviewers mentioned while streaming.
customer_reviews.author: Todbiker

customer_reviews.title: So far a much better choice than a Samsung
customer_reviews.text: My disk mechanism on my first Samsung Blu-ray player stopped working after a year. I recycled that one and bought a Samsung BDC6500. It made the video image go away after about a year although restarting the unit would bring it back. I went ahead and bought the Panasonic DMP-BDT210 from Amazon based on reviews and after a month or so I am very happy. I read some negative reviews about problems connecting to internet applications but I have not witnessed that. I also had the usual great delivery from Amazon that was much cheaper than my local Best Buy with none of the fear of dealing with Best Buy customer service should anything go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Schaffer

customer_reviews.title: WORKS FINE  BUT
customer_reviews.text: I now have 2 of these. The only problem i encounter is the ease of getting the closed captions. It is a 4 step process. This is something that could of been done with just one button as have my other machines in the past. The wife is deaf and it took her a bit of time on how to learn the steps neccassary to enable the captions. If it is a movie with alot of background noise where the speech is hard to hear, then I use it myself. Hell, I am getting old and cannot hear as good as i used to. Netflix streaming video does not put out movies with closed captioning
customer_reviews.author: DAVID A CAVALLARO

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and fast blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: The folks at Panasonic really did a nice job designing this - the menus are easy to use, I love the "hover your hand to eject" feature -- why doesn't every manufacturer have this? Do they assume everyone is watching a movie in a fully lit room so you don't have to hunt for buttons? Of course there are light switches, but still... The unit starts up fast, is silent, works great with Amazon on-demand, the picture quality and sound are great. I've had this unit for over a year and still going strong. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: S. Johnstone

customer_reviews.title: Buy it for the blu ray player quality
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a number of years. The blu ray player works great. I couldn't be happier with it. However the wifi connection is weak, and drops the connection to my network too easily. The Roku player doesn't have such problems and it is twice as far from the router. After multiple firmware upgrades, the wifi interface is better for navigating, but it is still a bit of a hassle to play local videos and music or watch internet TV.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Mike

customer_reviews.title: Has the Netflix streaming loading problem
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this player. It has the 1.80 firmware, I guess that is the latest, on the Pana website they only go to 1.68. Don't buy this player if you want to use it for streaming Netflix. Mine has the dreaded loading and loading and then "sorry can't play that movie right now" message. Sonys often have this same problem. There is no fix for this, if you get one you just have to not use it for Netflix. I have other media equipment that gets Netflix movies fine, on the same connection, so it's definately the Panasonic player's fault.
customer_reviews.author: Marko Pollo

customer_reviews.title: Its ok..but not great!
customer_reviews.text: I used the player predominantly for Netflix - and it failed there...i had instances when the movie would get stuck or the audio would stop and the only option would be to reboot the system - reminds of my Windows PC in 1997! The user interface is crappy, Youtube app is very bad - it wont forward / reverse and the search through the remote was a nightmare. This product is going back to where it came from! Don't buy this if you are looking to stream a lot otherwise its okay! Note: I had no trouble using the Blu Ray player / DVD player
customer_reviews.author: Frugal Desi

customer_reviews.title: Great Player, WOW
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth Blu-Ray player to purchase, and so far the best. My last player was a Pioneed BDP-51FD. This thing blowes the more expansive pioneer out of the water. First of all, its the fastest loading/playing stand alone Blu-Ray player ive seen. Its, almost the same speed as a DVD player. Picture and sound are incredible. Streaming serveces work great. Installation was a snap, it was literally 5 minutes and I was browsing Netflix and playing movies. The unit is also incredibly small. They really have shoehorned alot if techneology in a small unit. I would definately recomend the Panasonic DPM-BDT210. I couldnt be more happy, and lastly, you cant beat the price for what your getting.
customer_reviews.author: B. Brookshire

customer_reviews.title: No complaints so far...quite satisfied with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a Blue Ray Player for quite some time and finally purchased this product. Besides being able to play the standard media I needed something that was reasonably priced, wifi capable and simple to operate. I had read some reviews criticizing this product for its inability to connect to Netflix etc. I've not had that problem. It has worked as it is supposed to, no problems with Netflix. Although I do wish it had a web browser. If you are looking for an affordable BR player, simple to connect and operate. This is the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: Bargain Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic player!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this Blu Ray player. I did lots of research and this Panasonic was voted best Blu Ray of 2011 and the price was right so I chose it. It's really easy to navigate, the wireless was easy to set up and the picture is phenomenal. It's my first Blu Ray player and I'm really excited that I was able to get such a nice one for a great affordable price. It has gone up now that Christmas is over but it's still a good value. We've watched YouTube videos and most of them still manage a nice picture with little graininess. I highly recommend this player.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Blu-ray Player (with built in Wi-Fi!)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so our family would have a Blu-ray player downstairs to replace the DVD recorder we had. I based part of my decision on this model from the reviews it received and I have not been disappointed. Took it out of the box and had it up and running in about 15 minutes (this includes connecting to our home network and downloading the latest firmware update). Very intuitive remote and the Blu-ray disk of Up we got for Christmas looked great. I have not streamed any content yet but I have no doubt it will work like the rest of unit does. Very happy with this player.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Super Blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: This is my first blu-ray player and am very impressed with this. I haven't seen any negatives so far. I liked the ease of setup and internet wireless connectivity. Great streaming from all the different websites like netflix, amazon, you tube etc... Yet to see negatives... This product is sold for $199 in Target in NJ, so when I saw this product for $145, i thought it was a steal deal...... Reading reviews of Blu-Ray can be really confusing and if you are newbie in Blu-Ray players then you can buy this product and you will not repent your decision.
customer_reviews.author: Mayur Banwasi

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this DVD player for internet access for an older Panisonic plasma TV. It arrived in 3 days and setup was quick and easy. I was watching Net Flix via WiFi in 10 minutes after following the set up instruction. The Blu-Ray is excellent but I haven't used the 3D. I may upgrade to a 3D TV in the future but the old Plasma still has an excellent picture. I would recommend this unit to anyone but suggest that you hook up Panisonic to Panisonic, Sony to Sony, etc. These units seem to work better when they are brand name compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph L. Zipfel

customer_reviews.title: Nice economically priced, feature packed Blu-ray player.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Panasonic Blu-ray player. It has any feature I can ever envision using. If you put the connecting cords in the right spots on your components & have an Internet router it will upgrade it's firmware & you're ready to watch it in a few minutes. We're waiting for a 3D TV, till quality goes up & prices go down, so can't speak to it's 3D good nor bad. Panasonic seems to make their Blu-rays with streaming video over wireless, & that's why, in consideration of pricing, we've bought ours. Great value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: DES

customer_reviews.title: First time Panasonic failed me
customer_reviews.text: While the DMP-BDT210 is a full-featured Blu-ray player, it is S-L-O-W. The time lag between commands and navigation is atrocious, and the lag from bootup to actually connecting to the wireless network is unacceptable - sometimes over 5 minutes. I want to like it, but after 30 years as a loyal customer this is the first time Panasonic has really failed me, and it's like getting road-rage every time I just want to boot up Netflix.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but menus are too slow
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a couple years and it has always worked well. I connect it wirelessly to the internet and use the built-in Netflix app. I also watch a lot of burnt DVDs and BluRays and it never blinks an eye at them. I'd recommend it for standard movie watching only. The menus are very slow - they were even slow when this thing was brand new. I don't recommend it if you plan on using any of the apps that it comes installed with.
customer_reviews.author: Bill & Kim Tarbell

customer_reviews.title: No controls on the box, stupid auto-open feature
customer_reviews.text: Don't lose the remote. The only two buttons on the box are play and stop, which don't even necessarily allow you to play the disk as they don't navigate the menus on a dvd/blu-ray. There is a ridiculous sensor on top of the box that allows you to waive your hand over it like a Jedi and the disk tray will open or close. Every time I dust it, it opens and closes. Every time I reach over the top of it to grab something, it opens and closes. This is totally annoying.
customer_reviews.author: J. Spruce

customer_reviews.title: Best blu-ray player i've experienced... HANDS DOWN.
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I did after I got this was connect to wi-fi and upgrade the software on the player. Most new players and game systems give you that option now. Took a little bit to figure out how to get into the wi-fi settings but once I did, it was a piece of cake. Logged right on to my home router. The picture, sound, everything will blow you away! Blew away my PS3 blu-ray player easily!! Got this refurbished for $80 and if it kicks the bucket down the road, I will get another one.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Blu-ray Player
customer_reviews.text: The BDT-210 is my 2nd Blu-ray player. The 1st was less than acceptable. Set-up with the Panasonic was very easy: plug it in and turn it on, navigate to the network settings, and presto! the player acquired an IP address, picked the encryption scheme for my wireless network, asked for the password, connected and then downloaded and installed the latest firmware. I like the dedicated remote buttons, especially Netflix. Streams videos with a few hiccups. Accesses files on my PC seemlessly. Start up is much quicker than the previous player. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: JBR

customer_reviews.title: It gets the Blu ribbon
customer_reviews.text: It has fantastic picture and sound. The no-touch open/close is a nice touch. I'd recommend an SD card though to take advantage of all the features. They're pretty cheap and readily available if you don't already have a spare. I will say though, I'm not using the 3D function, only because I don't have a 3D TV. It was cheaper for me to go ahead and buy a 3D player, and ensure I will have something capable of playing 3D if I decide to upgrade in the future. So, I cannot commend on its 3D abilities.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Very good, but not GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I just hooked up my new Panasonic DMP-BDT210 last night and it could not have been easier. Everything seemed to work fine and as expected. The UI is easy enough to work with and the setup was rather intuitive. My only issue is with the time it take for the VieraCast to load up. At times is loads up pretty quickly; whereas, other times it takes a while to switch between apps. I look forward to Panasonic partnering with other picture folks like Snapfish, streaming video like Hulu, or social media like Facebook.
customer_reviews.author: Gongagas

customer_reviews.title: Great value from Australia
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic Blu-Ray and DVD player, there's no question about that from the reviews here and numerous awards its won (see WhatHifi.com) so I won't cover that. This model is not very available in Australia, the BDT110 (model below this) is but you won't find it for under $200. Fortunately the BDT210 has automatic dual voltage so works without problem with a simple plug adapter on Australia 240v It is not region free however, this can be achieved with an updated firmware (small cost) From an Australian perspective, this is an amazing value, high quality Blu-Ray player that more than fulfills all my requirements.
customer_reviews.author: Move D

customer_reviews.title: Firmware just does not update
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to update the firmware on this player many times but the update just does not complete. I have tried it on a wired connection too but have not had any success. There seems to be some specific way to burn a disc for the update to work and this is not very clear from the manual ot he process of burning a disc mentioned in the manual does not work either. Other than that the DVD player is good audio and video quality. But I was really interested in the internet apps.
customer_reviews.author: Eternalsands

customer_reviews.title: Clunky menus
customer_reviews.text: It does a good job playing DVD and Blu-Ray discs, which is the number one function. I like the motion sensor to open and close the disc tray. The unit is so lightweight that pushing buttons slides it toward the back of the shelf. Going through the menus is a bit clunky, but that seems to be a common complaint about most blu-ray players. This one does have a Netflix button on the remote that lets you bypass the menus to go directly to streaming,
customer_reviews.author: C. Hinton

customer_reviews.title: We are not tech people
customer_reviews.text: We are not technies - I have to say this now so people know that I have no idea the technical aspects of this blu-ray * This has worked well so far - no issues * Great picture - we have an older plasma (no 3D, 720) - still looks amazing * Easy to open by moving your hand over the top * Love the remote that has a netflix button - * Online access is easy to navigate and setup - even for non tech people * Initial setup was very easy and fast Truly, Pen Penlittle
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Strangehead

customer_reviews.title: Packed with Features!  Remote is NOT universal.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great Blu-Ray player! The motion sensing tray opening is useful for a dark room during movie marathons. The only thing I was disappointed in was the inability of the remote to be used as a universal remote. We have a Sharp LCD we would like to be able to at least control the sound on during movies but, no we have to keep two remotes handy. I would think something tat simple could have been included. What I did find out is that the remote is only "universal" with other Panasonic devices.
customer_reviews.author: B.K.

customer_reviews.title: Could be very good, but...
customer_reviews.text: Chose this over other players partly because it has an SD card slot. The darn thing can't play a thing, though. Got all my home videos in .avi or .mov, with lpcm audio. Doesn't play any of that and never will. Guys at Panasonic told me (nerve!) to buy a Panasonic camera 'cause that records AVCHD, only thing this player supports from the SD slot. So, even though it loads blu-rays fast and has very smooth and clear playback, doesn't have the Netflix issue many users describe, its almost nonexistent SD/USB file format support makes this unit pretty ordinary. Pretty disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: aditud

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure which Blu-ray player to purchase as a Christmas gift this year, so I did a lot of on-line review reading. This Panasonic got some of the higher ratings on Amazon. After much deliberation, I purchased this machine. It was shipped quickly and easy to install. We have watched several regular and Blu-ray films since, and have had no issues. The pictures are clear and vibrant. I have yet to see how it works with my Netflix, but hopefully there will be no issues. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: gidge66

customer_reviews.title: I love this device!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Panasonic BDT210 specifically because of the great reviews (CNET and Amazon), and they were right! It was easy to hook up and it streams videos even better than my Mac laptop. Originally, I bought a video streaming device, but my audio system didn't have the right inputs, so sent it back, spent a few more dollars and bought the Blu-ray player. I've had it for a few weeks and I think it has only dropped the video connection once...and that may have been due to Comcast. I love being able to watch my Amazon videos on my HD TV, rather than on my laptop. DVDs work great too. I love this player!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Outdated technology, lost Netflix
customer_reviews.text: This was actually a replacement unit, I had broken the disc tray by closing a cabinet door when the tray was open. The first 210 was our intitial foray into Blu-ray, streaming video, all that stuff. We were happy with it. Then Netflix disappeared and a couple of hours on the phone and multiple tech fix attempts did not fix it. We returned the unit and purchase a more recent Sony unit. We're happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: dabbler

customer_reviews.title: I now own two.
customer_reviews.text: This DVD player is a great deal. In fact, I bought a second one (for another TV obviously). The price is right, the quality is excellent,and a few of the applets are actually useful. I have Netflix on my Apple TV but I was trying to figure out how to get Amazon's Instant Video on my HDTV since Apple clearly wasn't going to help me with that one. This works well. I actually like the fact that you can wave your hand above the player and the disc drawer opens or closes. Very nice when you're in a dark room.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: A+ BluRay Player
customer_reviews.text: Shipping from Amazon, two days! Unbelievable how good shipping is with Amazon. But, to the point. The Panasonic DMP-BDT210 has a perfect picture, easy to install and plenty of features. I especially like the WiFi that's built in. It's a very sleek looking machine, thin probably only two inches thick including the legs. It has a sensor on the top that you wave your hand over to open it which is really cool but don't expect to put anything on top of it. I would recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Shoby1

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic  DMP-BDT210 Blu-ray DVD Player
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought the Panasonic DVD player to match my new Panasonic 50" HD TV. Originally, I was going to use my Vizio 3D Blu-ray DVD player since it was only 6 months old. However, the Vizio stopped playing. I read the reviews on all of these players and decided on the Panasonic. Very satisfied with it. Easy to set up. Comes on immediately. No delays as experienced with the Vizio, when it worked. Very good color. Highly recommend it to anybody interested in it.
customer_reviews.author: sixtyplus

customer_reviews.title: About the Netflix issue
customer_reviews.text: I like the player overall. I did run into the same issue others have reported where Netflix streaming stopped working. However, I believe that the bug is related to use of the Netflix instant viewing queue. I was able to get Netflix working again by deleting my instant viewing queue at the web site and then waiting some time for some kind of cached information to clear (info located where?? - possibly at my router, possibly at Netflix, I'm not really sure). I'd encourage others having a Netflix streaming problem to try that, as writing the queued titles on a piece of paper instead is not that big of a drawback.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Stern

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for its NETFLIX feature and it had WiFi built in. It also had a couple other features that I thought I might use. The WiFi set it self up simply and quickly and the NetFlilx is built into the remote and easy to use. Also I have been converting my old slides on to and SD card and there is a slot in the product for the SD card. When I plugged in the SD card with my copied slides, not only did it bring them up but it gave me several options for showing them on my TV. The quality and program was great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Picture FREEZES when watching DVDs
customer_reviews.text: I consistently have issues when playing DVDs. The pictures freezes, hesitates, show blocks on the screen, and skips forward. This happens on both Blu Ray and regular DVDs. It makes watching a movie extremely frustrating. This is not a new issue. I've had problems shortly after buying the unit. I purchased a Sony player for another TV in the house and have not had a single problem. I would avoid Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lange

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Player
customer_reviews.text: It plays Blu-ray/DVD's as expected without any hiccups. The upconversion of DVD's is as good as expected. I use this player mostly for streaming though. Why buy a separate Apple TV or Roku device? This player has Netflix, Hulu Plus, Amazon Instant Video. The only negative I can give is that the user interface is not as smooth and "pretty" as what you might get from an Apple TV, but it serves its purpose. Great Panasonic product and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pak

customer_reviews.title: Looks good so far
customer_reviews.text: So this is my first BlueRay so I dont know what the others are like. - I think the touchless open/close drawer is a nice perk but probably unecessary. - the menu options seem slow to me but other people seem to think it is fast so that must mean the other bluerays are really really slow. - netflix and amazon etc work as planned, again seem to lag but maybe just cause I am impatient. - overall, to me, no frills BlueRay but got in at a good price with a promotional discount on Amazon, whenever there is a deal it always makes me happy.
customer_reviews.author: M4517

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my husband for Father's Day. Viewing BluRay's was the easy part. With our limited technology skills, we didn't even attempt the Netflix interface until we had plenty of time to talk to tech support should we need it. When we finally did attempt to connect the wireless feature, within minutes our screen said it was searching for wireless; we pushed the netflix button on the controller and we were choosing a Netflix to view! It was so quick we thought we were at the beginning of a lengthy installation and were shocked to realize we were done! We are very satisfied with the product and highly recommend it for others.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi

customer_reviews.title: best integrated blu-ray player on the market
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this player in july 2011 I love the internet apps, and the fact that panasonic has updates, so you can always get any new apps when they become available. it seems like every month, there is a new app the wi-fi is great and I like the 2d to 3d feature which allows you to watch some 2d video in 3d watching the free 3d AVATAR video in my opinion was better than watching the movie at the theater
customer_reviews.author: docd

customer_reviews.title: OK for DVD and limited web apps but cannot access web browser
customer_reviews.text: For the price that this item costs it should include the ability to browse the web rather than constrain users to a very limited number of apps that users are allowed to access via the Internet. It feels like buying a car and then finding out that it only runs within very specific neighborhoods that your car company has selected and has a fee paying contract with. From my perspective, this is totally unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this player to replace the Samsung blu-ray I bought 2 years ago. The Samsung would no longer accept updates and would need a hardware replacement at my cost. I did a lot of online research and the Panasonic stood out from the crowd. I was amazed at how quick and easy the set up was in less than five minutes from turning on the unit for the first time to completing the wifi connection I was done! Super quick with loading a disc to playing, awesome picture and sound. The waving of your hand to open the tray is a great feature. So far loving this player, a tip of the toque to Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh

customer_reviews.title: Matches Beautifully with Panaconic 3d TVs
customer_reviews.text: I have this Pared with Panasonic ET5 3d Tv. I have put a 3 year warranty on the product, Very happy with it Pros 1. picture quality on DVDS upconversion is Amazing , most movies look just as good or same as Bluray 2. Bluray 3d is excellent 3. loading time is fast 4. The Hand sweep to open and close bluray tray is cool, works for us every time 5. menu is simple to understand 6 audio quality and choices Cons 1 we have seen our Lcd screen flicker bought for a bargain Very good
customer_reviews.author: EJB

customer_reviews.title: i love it
customer_reviews.text: it might not be the best, but i love it. for the price i feel like i got the best i could and im a very happy customer. it does everything i need and is not slow in any way on anything it does. use it for pandora often without any hiccups. blu rays play fine and look great. used youtube once with 0 problems have not tried 3d buy it, u wont regret it!
customer_reviews.author: cruzer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent player
customer_reviews.text: Everything works as advertised. Set-up was very easy. The firmware updated by following the instructions in the quick setup guide. The player loads discs quickly. The Netflix button on the remote is very convenient. Netflix videos play flawlessly. You tube videos load and play easily. You tube only plays half screen, the other half has the search information and video que, similar to your computer display. There is no option for full screen that I can find. I have a Panasonic TV so it is also convenient to only need one remote while using the DVD player. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I just was looking for a 3D Blueray player and decided the buy this one and it works great! The Netflix app even takes advantage of the 5.1 sound system. The hand motion is pretty cool also! The only problem I had was trying to get the internet to work on setup, since I live in a rural remote area my internet is a microwave signal so it would not auto assign a IP address, so I entered the network information in manually and it worked!
customer_reviews.author: Jay ManTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bluray option
customer_reviews.text: This was on sale and had a nice feature set, so I took the plunge. The interface is a bit cluttered and tricky to navigate, but it gets on wifi easily and does a good job with Amazon Video on Demand as well as basic disc playing. There is a corresponding remote app for iOS that works about 50% of the time. When that app works, it makes navigating the interface much easier, but any issue with the app is not reflected on this review of the bluray player.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: BEST BLU RAY !
customer_reviews.text: After researching and browsing for days, CNET convinced me that this was the best blu-ray ! Picture pops at you, crystal clear, colors are deep and rich, you're watching and it almost appears to be life-like, we're one very happy folks! Web-inteface feature gives Netflix and some other online VOD apps, what sold me the most on this model was that it was rated one on the fastest loading blu-ray dvd's out there.
customer_reviews.author: Juan C. Julien

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended from my perspective
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I bought this well over a year ago and didn't realize I had never offered a review until it popped up in my Amazon list. It has worked well. It has had the advantage of several firmware upgrades since the time of purchase to add even more online streaming capabilities as they reach the market. I am satisfied customer and would recommend it hightly
customer_reviews.author: Ron Tissier

customer_reviews.title: Nice Panasonic 3D Player
customer_reviews.text: I was researching about a good and reliable Blu-ray 3d player and after a month I noticed that the rating for this player is much better than Sony or Samsung, so I bought this one and so far I'm really happy with it, it looks nice and function well, it plays MKV format form DVD or USB flash Drive also. I have not used the applications because my TV has all of them. So totally I'm happy with my purchase. I will update my comment if I notice anything about the system.
customer_reviews.author: H. Edrakimotlagh

customer_reviews.title: DMP-BDT210 -An Excellent View
customer_reviews.text: Panasonic DMP-BDT210 integrated-Wi-Fi 3D Blu-ray DVD Player is priced to sell. The unit is easy to use with or without the freely included remote control. I looked at 20 of the best blu-ray players before deciding on purchasing Panasonic DMP-BDT210 integrated-Wi-Fi 3D Blu-ray DVD Player. However what sold me on this Panasonic electronic jewel were styling, fair pricing and superior product. I own an old Samsung blu-ray player and my newly purchased DMP-BDT210 is 10X better.DMP-BDT210 additional features include:all inclusive wifi not needing a wifi adapter; internet apps; fast loading time and ability to open the unit with a wave of your hand.Yes, buy this unit because I did all the research for you.
customer_reviews.author: Milwaukee Feedbacker

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good BD-player
customer_reviews.text: The BD movies load pretty quick and look great. Going through the menu for the online servies seems a little sluggish, but for the most part I only use the Netflix service anyway and there is a dedicated button on the remote for that. I have a Sony bd player already and this one is just as good. Overall, at this price point it is an excellent player.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Spadowski

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an old Panasonic DMP-BD60 DVD player with this one, mainly because I wanted to access movies through Netflix. It was easy to set up, and now it is connected to my home network, so we can also enjoy photos from my picture collection. And music we like through Pandora. The unit is fast, plays DVDs flawlessly, and the picture on our Samsung LED TV is crisp, with deep, saturated colors. Netflix works without a hitch. Great piece of equipment for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Nardi

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to play Blu Ray movies and stream Netflix, both of which it does very well. I read online people were having issues with Netflix not loading properly but I have watched several streaming movies on it and have not had a single problem, guess I am one of the lucky ones or they have fixed the problem. Loading time is fast, menus are easy to navigate, and the touch free sensor is cool, although a bit gimmicky.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good Bluray player but...
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box the unit works only 98% well. I say 98% because there's this periodic flicker on the TV screen the unit seems to be causing. I was watching Avatar last night and it happened about 10 times. It's a microsecond of static. This also happens with web content. It's connected to my LG TV via a decent HDMI cable, so it shouldn't be the cable's fault. Dealing with 800-211-PANA is a PAINA to say the least. To have to pursue a warranty repair or replacement on a brand new unit is disheartening.
customer_reviews.author: Arlexitus

customer_reviews.title: No issues at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these and haven't had any of the issues described with Netflix. First thing I did was update the firmware, then I set up the Netflix. I am running wireless through my Airport Extreme router and have used both AT&T (DSL) and now Comcast (cable) for internet, no issues with either one. The ONLY issue that I have had with Netflix that I didnt have with my wired BD65, is that occassionally the screen flickers for a micro second. Maybe this is a wireless issue? I havent tried it wired so I cannot confirm my theory. Otherwise, I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: headclouds

customer_reviews.title: I have had a few problems with viewing Blue Ray DVD's
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the remote, the button to go to the Panasonic program is too close to the arrow buttons and I find myself back in a program that I can not even use and it is time consuming. Overall the box works pretty well as advertised. As for viewing DVD's, occaisionally the system just freezes, I wipe the DVD but it just will not continue. These are NETFLIX dvd's so that may also contribute to the problem. I have not been able tosee damgae on the disks.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Gearhart

customer_reviews.title: 3D Entertainment at a nice price.
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I could hope for and then some. 3d works beautifully, lots of apps to use, (some people say no netflix,I have it on mine.)Wish i had waited on this player as most of the units I bought when blu ray first came out, are slow or worse at reading some discs, and to think I paid twice what this unit runs, for them. It pays to wait if you are not as impulsive as I am, the technology gets better and the price goes down, enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Annoying pop-up, but a good player overall.
customer_reviews.text: Great player. The pop-up at the start of playback is a little annoying. Wish that only stayed on the screen for 5 seconds, instead of a minute. Would definitely buy this trouble-free player again.
customer_reviews.author: ksash

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned with all of the reviews commenting on Netflix problems. I bought this despite that because of the great reviews on Cnet and am very happy that I did. Very easy to set up. I updated the firmware before starting the set-up and have had absolutely no problem with Netflix (or anything else). Easy to do and very easy to use. Definitely a good value. I would recommend this if you are in the market for a new, "smart" DVD/Blu-Ray player.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ascher

customer_reviews.title: Meets and exceeds my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Chose Panasonic because of integration with my flat screen Panasonic plasma TV. Chose Amazon because of my trust. Delivery was quick, setup and update also quick. Operation is great. Especially like one button to NetFlix, we had been accessing NetFlix through our Wii which was much more cumbersome. UPDATE: Now after using the unit for almost one year, Still very pleased with our purchase! Trouble free!
customer_reviews.author: John E. Mcmahon

customer_reviews.title: I love this blue ray player
customer_reviews.text: I love this blue ray player, its one of the very few left that have component and/or digital outputs. I have not updated my TV yet - I have need to - its works great and the picture is awesome. But it doesn't have an HDMI input - so I was extremely limited on what I could buy for a blue ray player. This unit works awesome. great investment.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: This unit plays both DVD's and Blue Rays with excellent quality. Loads both formats quickly. It does not take much space as it is rather small. Sound quality is great. Streams video from Amazon with good quality. Internet menu seems a little slow in loading. Easy to update firmware. Have not used it for 3D videos as the TV set does not support this feature. Able to change output to match DVI input.
customer_reviews.author: Tirso

customer_reviews.title: not for netflix
customer_reviews.text: Bluray features good but Netflix is no good. I get the "black flash" as netflix changes resolutions form high def to low def and back several times during the movie. Even the kids notics on cartoons. :( Even tried it with a ethernet cable and same thing. Swapped it with a Roku and it does not have that problem.
customer_reviews.author: cousinDan

customer_reviews.title: great product amazing delivery
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item saturday night and it was at my door Monday am. The player was a piece of cake to set up from a non geek. It found my router right away and set it up automatically. I tried netflix and amazon prime video and worked flawless. There were no delays or buffering while watching a netflix or amazon movie. Blu Rays looked fantastic. I would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-Ray player
customer_reviews.text: Video quality is great on our 42" LCD. Really like the "wave-of-hand" sensor on the top of the box for opening and closing the tray. That sensor really beats trying to find the little button in the dark. The first unit arrived with a bubble in the plastic covering on top, but the vendor issued a return shipment label and shipped the replacement immediately. Really happy after 3 months use.
customer_reviews.author: DirtMaster

customer_reviews.title: Some problems
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a 3D tv so I don't know how that looks. The video blacks out every once in a while when playing dvds. I tried several different cables and the problem persists so I'm guessing it's an issue with the player. It doesn't always connect with my wi-fi. My roku connects fine so I know it's not a router issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amy P

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: I hate to say it but this dvd player is a real piece of junk compared to a Sony.The wi fi on this is constantly messing up. I do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JAS

customer_reviews.title: Great DVD Player
customer_reviews.text: I have used past reviews when deciding what to purchase. I was nervous about the new updated version but this was so easy to use. programmed in about 10 minutes. Gave an excellant picture. Next time I turned on the DVD player it automatically asked if I wanted an update. Responded yes and updated with no problem. Great product and recommend this to anyone. Real easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: E. Fitch

customer_reviews.title: Not bad except netflix
customer_reviews.text: Watching Netflix with this is not very good. It has a video glitch that many are reporting. It momentarily goes dim or blank. I have two Rokus and a logitech revue and they work flawless for netflix viewing. I'm hoping that Panasonic can fix this. The Amazon Prime videos work great! So has to be a codec issue or something software related. Would return if I could.
customer_reviews.author: JakeHall

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, Buggy Netflix
customer_reviews.text: Guys, stay away from this player. The apps are slow and Netflix keeps flashing when streaming movies. Google "Panasonic Netflix black flash" Amazon keeps buffering. When I use Roku to play amazon, it does not do the buffering. The BDs play fine but I don't like the Panasonic apps interface. Look at Sony or Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: awesome, for 2 reasons
customer_reviews.text: One, and most important, it's a great Blu-Ray. Not just the DVD playback, but with the internet connections I was able to ditch my AppleTV and Roku. I had Apple TV to stream Itunes stuff, however this baby has a DLNA protocol service which gives you the same functionality, If you have Windows 7 it's built in,, I have XP and downloaded a free DLNA emulator, there's many out there. Netflix, MLB, Amazon, YouTube, etc.s are available as well. Two, it came with a #D Aviator disk which I had no interest in and sold it on E-Bay for $60 in 10 minutes, I kid you not. So the net cost was around $60!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Townsend

customer_reviews.title: Looks new works perfect incredible
customer_reviews.text: This Panasonic WiFi 3D Blue-Ray Player , Does everything Quick and in a perfect mater, It works getter than a few newer ones out there, this one of those , that many times an older model, works better than some other newer models, watched a 3d Blue ray perfectly with stunning picture, and in just 5 Minutes i was playing around with netflix, this is an Outstanding machine.
customer_reviews.author: Ricanguy.

customer_reviews.title: Firmware upgrade is essential!
customer_reviews.text: I needed an internet-ready Blu-ray player to play discs and to stream video from Netflix and Amazon. I was motivated to buy this model because of the Avatar 3D Blu-ray disc promotion. I hesitated because of the reviews which noted problems with Nexflix playback but I upgraded the firmware to version 1.63 immediately after I configured the wireless connection. It's been awesome so far. Great 3D, Blu-ray playback and streaming. As good as my PS3 - and without the noise. I'd recommend without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Jay G.

customer_reviews.title: Let's Go Netflix
customer_reviews.text: Works well with Netflix....easy to use. My one criticism is that it is difficult to use closed captioning. I still haven't figured out how to do it. It might be a glitch in the system. Otherwise I am impressed with the quality of the picture. Using the Viera feature is helpful too as it limits the number of remotes you need. If someone figures out the closed captioning piece please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: antbethf

customer_reviews.title: great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for my father as a retirement gift. at the time i was able to get it at a gold box deal. i also ordered the hdmi cable through amazon which was also a steal. i had no problem hooking it up to the tv nor getting it onto the home network. though the tv it's connected to is only 720p and not 3d, bluray looks beautiful and it does an excellent job upconverting dvds.
customer_reviews.author: E. Raines

customer_reviews.title: This DVD Player is the coolest!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this DVD player! Not only does it do it's primary function of playing DVD's and Blu Ray's with great picture quality......but I love all the internet options. Our friends come over and are always so impressed that we can stream Youtube, Amazon VOD, Netflix, AND Pandora! It has a lot of great internet options, and comes at a nice price! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Missing In Action
customer_reviews.text: I like this new blu-ray player but there are a couple of things missing. 1.The remote cannot be programmed to run any other devices; in this day and age that capability seems very common place. 2.This unit plays a very limited number of file types. WAV nope, FLV nope, and there a others. It seems like the ability to play many file types would be standard.
customer_reviews.author: Gretsch

product_meta.title: Panasonic DMP-BDT210 Integrated-Wi-Fi 3D Blu-ray DVD Player
product_meta.description:
Internet-ready TVs use your broadband connection to deliver dynamic content, whether it's streaming video from Netflix, new music from Pandora, or a quick glance at today's weather forecast.

AMAZON.COM


3D TECHNOLOGY CHECKLIST
This product is 3D-related. To help you get a great 3D experience, use the checklist below to ensure you have everything you need. 3D viewing requires:

A Display
First, you'll need a 3D-ready display--whether it's a 3D HDTV, 3D projector, or 3D computer monitor. These displays have more processing power than standard 2D models for displaying 3D images in rapid succession. A Source
Your display may be ready for 3D playback, but you'll still need a device to read 3D content. This can be a cable box with a subscription to a 3D channel, a 3D Blu-ray Disc player, or a PlayStation 3 system. 3D Content
3D content--the actual entertainment, in other words--will be played back using the source mentioned above, whether it's a 3D broadcast from your cable provider, a 3D Blu-ray Disc, or a 3D video game. 3D Glasses
For now, the vast majority of 3D HDTVs require glasses for 3D viewing. Many use powered "active shutter" glasses, others polarized "passive" glasses. You'll need one pair per viewer, and they'll have to be compatible with your display, whether they're the same brand, or a pair of "universal" glasses designed to work across brands. HDMI Cable
To connect your source (such as a 3D Blu-ray Disc player) to your display, you'll need a high-speed HDMI cable. Cables with this designation feature bandwidth speeds up to 10.2 Gbps (gigabits per second), for carrying the 3D signal without any loss of quality. 
If you want to get more information about 3D, shop our 3D products, watch videos, or interact with other customers, we invite you to visit 3D 101, our customer center about everything 3D. 



INTERNET-READY TELEVISION
Internet-ready TVs use your broadband connection to deliver dynamic content, whether it's streaming video from Netflix, new music from Pandora, or a quick glance at today's weather forecast.

Although there is overlap, each manufacturer offers a unique bundle of free or paid services, including streaming video and music, social networking apps, online photo galleries, news and financial updates, weather info, sports scores, and a variety of other smartphone-like applications.

Manufacturers continue to add new content to their offerings, keeping customers current through firmware updates, and making a bit of research a prudent step in your buying decision.

Learn more about Internet TVs, how they work, what services are offered by different manufacturers, and exactly what you'll need to get started at our Internet TV 101 customer center.






(March 2011)


Step into the 3D World. Watch 3D movies at home with Full HD 3D technology with the DMP-BDT210.

FULL HD 3D BLU-RAY DISC PLAYBACK
Advanced 2D image technology accumulated over the years at the Panasonic Hollywood Laboratory (PHL) has also been applied to 3D image playback, allowing high quality images to approach original film quality. Life-like 3D images with dramatic leaping effects and enhanced depth, luster and texture are beautifully reproduced.

Two International CES Innovations 2011 Design and Engineering Awards in both the video components category and video display category. 2D-3D CONVERSION
The 2D-3D Conversion makes it possible to convert images from DVDs and Blu-ray Discs into 3D with natural depth perception. This allows you to watch your prized DVD movie collection in 3D with real-life depth, for even greater viewing enjoyment.

3D EFFECT CONTROLLER
The 3D Effect Controller lets you moderate the leaping effects of 3D images. It also lets you adjust the amount of depth so you can view expansive images and enjoy movies with the exact kind of 3D effects you want.

TOUCH-FREE SENSOR
A motion sensor is now provided on the top panel of the Blu-ray Disc player. The disc tray can be opened or closed by simply passing your hand over the sensor. This is very useful when your hands are full or when you're in a dark room and can't see the buttons clearly.

ORIGINAL PANASONIC BLU-RAY DISC PLAYER PRODUCT FEATURES 


QUICK ACCESS TO THE MENU SCREEN
You can instantly access the Skype menu screen by simply pressing the Skype button on the remote control. This is very handy because it lets you easily access the menu screen even while you're watching a TV program or movie.

INCOMING RINGTONES
While watching a TV program or movie, a ringtone from the player tells you that you have a call. The ringtone also rings during standby mode. 

*The incoming call cannot be received during Blu-ray Disc playback

AUTO ANSWERING VIDEO MESSAGE
Record an original message onto an SD Memory Card* and set it as your answering voice message. The message will respond automatically when you receive a phone call while you're away. 

*SD card not included 

*Minimum 512MB SD card required

VIDEO MAIL RECORDING
Callers can also record messages for you onto the SD Memory Card, so you can confirm the messages when you return home. 



VIERA CAST
VIERA CAST has been further enhanced with CinemaNow and VUDU, which allow you to stream movies. You can also access other content from the special VIERA CAST screen. And you can check weather and stock information on other sites.

DLNA / WI-FI READY
Connect a DLNA-compatible VIERA and DLNA-compatible AV equipment to your home network, and you can watch movies, listen to music, and view photos from any room in the house. VIERA's Wi-Fi capability gives you even more layout flexibility.

PANASONIC BLU-RAY REMOTE 2011
Panasonic Blu-ray Remote 2011 is a remote controller app for your iPhone or iPod touch to control select Panasonic Blu-ray Disc players over your Wi-Fi network. You can even launch VIERA CAST, Netflix, and Skype directly. Learn more about the Panasonic Blu-ray Remote 2011 app.
